item.title: How to use echo $! to wait for a background process to finish
item.description: The echo $! command returns the process ID of the most recently started background process. This can be very useful when you want to wait for a process to finish before continuing with your script.

item.title: klogg is the new glogg
item.description: I used glogg for years but noticed that the last release was in 2017 and noticed that there is a fork called klogg which has many improvements: klogg

item.title: How to create a random String with Bash
item.description: With this approach you can create nearly every random text or number. tr -dc '0-9A-Za-z' < /dev/random | head -c10 Explanation: tr -dc deletes all characters except those specified in the argument. This means that we waste a lot of bytes, but for occasional manual use, this is usually acceptable. | head -c10 prints the first 10 characters of the output of the previous command.
